intro: Palicourea stenosepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled palicourea, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
